trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>Get Definition</languageKeyword> operation returns an existing profile definition.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>Get Definition</languageKeyword> operation returns an existing profile definition.

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>Get Definition</languageKeyword> request is specified as follows.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>Get Definition</languageKeyword> request is specified as follows.

trans-unit.source: Replace <codeInline>%%amp;lt;subscription-id%%amp;gt;</codeInline> with the subscription ID and <codeInline>%%amp;lt;profile-name%%amp;gt;</codeInline> with the name of the profile.
trans-unit.target: Replace <codeInline>%%amp;lt;subscription-id%%amp;gt;</codeInline> with the subscription ID and <codeInline>%%amp;lt;profile-name%%amp;gt;</codeInline> with the name of the profile.

trans-unit.source: You must make sure that the request that is made to the management service is secure.
trans-unit.target: You must make sure that the request that is made to the management service is secure.

trans-unit.source: For additional details, see <link xlink:href="1becb7dc-1cdc-4db4-8ae8-7e351c96c251" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Authenticating Service Management Requests</link>.
trans-unit.target: For additional details, see <link xlink:href="1becb7dc-1cdc-4db4-8ae8-7e351c96c251" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Authenticating Service Management Requests</link>.

trans-unit.source: The following table describes the request headers.
trans-unit.target: The following table describes the request headers.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the version of the operation to use for this request.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the version of the operation to use for this request.

trans-unit.source: This header should be set to <userInput>2011-10-01</userInput> or later.
trans-unit.target: This header should be set to <userInput>2011-10-01</userInput> or later.

trans-unit.source: For more information about versioning headers, see <externalLink><linkText>Service Management Versioning</linkText><linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windowsazure/gg592580.aspx</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about versioning headers, see <externalLink><linkText>Service Management Versioning</linkText><linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windowsazure/gg592580.aspx</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: The response includes an HTTP status code, a set of response headers, and a response body.
trans-unit.target: The response includes an HTTP status code, a set of response headers, and a response body.

trans-unit.source: A successful operation returns status code 200 (OK).
trans-unit.target: A successful operation returns status code 200 (OK).

trans-unit.source: For information about status codes, see <link xlink:href="10f8d244-4649-4063-b6c9-7a20765513fa" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Status and Error Codes</link>.
trans-unit.target: For information about status codes, see <link xlink:href="10f8d244-4649-4063-b6c9-7a20765513fa" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Status and Error Codes</link>.

trans-unit.source: The response for this operation includes the following headers.
trans-unit.target: The response for this operation includes the following headers.

trans-unit.source: The response may also include additional standard HTTP headers.
trans-unit.target: The response may also include additional standard HTTP headers.

trans-unit.source: All standard headers conform to the <externalLink><linkText>HTTP/1.1 protocol specification</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=150478</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: All standard headers conform to the <externalLink><linkText>HTTP/1.1 protocol specification</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=150478</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: A value that uniquely identifies a request made against the management service.
trans-unit.target: A value that uniquely identifies a request made against the management service.

trans-unit.source: The format of the response body is as follows:
trans-unit.target: The format of the response body is as follows:

trans-unit.source: Specifies the DNS Time-to-Live (TTL) that informs the Local DNS resolvers how long to cache DNS entries.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the DNS Time-to-Live (TTL) that informs the Local DNS resolvers how long to cache DNS entries.

trans-unit.source: The value is an integer from 30 through 999,999.
trans-unit.target: The value is an integer from 30 through 999,999.

trans-unit.source: Indicates whether this definition is enabled or disabled for the profile.
trans-unit.target: Indicates whether this definition is enabled or disabled for the profile.

trans-unit.source: Indicates the version of the definition returned.
trans-unit.target: Indicates the version of the definition returned.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the number of seconds between consecutive attempts to check the status of a monitoring endpoint.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the number of seconds between consecutive attempts to check the status of a monitoring endpoint.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the time to wait for a response from the monitoring endpoint.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the time to wait for a response from the monitoring endpoint.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the number of consecutive failures to allow on an endpoint before taking the endpoint out of the rotation in the load balancer.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the number of consecutive failures to allow on an endpoint before taking the endpoint out of the rotation in the load balancer.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the protocol to use to monitor endpoint health.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the protocol to use to monitor endpoint health.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the port used to monitor endpoint health.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the port used to monitor endpoint health.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the verb to use when making an HTTP request to monitor endpoint health.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the verb to use when making an HTTP request to monitor endpoint health.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the path relative to the endpoint domain name to probe for health state.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the path relative to the endpoint domain name to probe for health state.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the HTTP status code expected from a healthy endpoint.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the HTTP status code expected from a healthy endpoint.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the load balancing method to use to distribute connections.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the load balancing method to use to distribute connections.

trans-unit.source: Encapsulates the list of Azure Traffic Manager endpoints.
trans-unit.target: Encapsulates the list of Azure Traffic Manager endpoints.

trans-unit.source: If the load balancing method is set to <languageKeyword>Failover</languageKeyword>, traffic to the endpoints is load balanced in the sequential order in which the endpoints are returned.
trans-unit.target: If the load balancing method is set to <languageKeyword>Failover</languageKeyword>, traffic to the endpoints is load balanced in the sequential order in which the endpoints are returned.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the status of monitoring for the endpoint.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the status of monitoring for the endpoint.

trans-unit.source: If set to enabled, the endpoint is considered by the load balancing method and is monitored.
trans-unit.target: If set to enabled, the endpoint is considered by the load balancing method and is monitored.

trans-unit.source: When defined as part of a <languageKeyword>Policy</languageKeyword>, indicates health status for the overall load balancing policy.
trans-unit.target: When defined as part of a <languageKeyword>Policy</languageKeyword>, indicates health status for the overall load balancing policy.

trans-unit.source: When defined as part of an <languageKeyword>Endpoint</languageKeyword>, indicates health status for the endpoint.
trans-unit.target: When defined as part of an <languageKeyword>Endpoint</languageKeyword>, indicates health status for the endpoint.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the location for the <embeddedLabel>TrafficManager</embeddedLabel> and <embeddedLabel>Any</embeddedLabel> endpoint types, but only if they have been set.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the location for the <embeddedLabel>TrafficManager</embeddedLabel> and <embeddedLabel>Any</embeddedLabel> endpoint types, but only if they have been set.

trans-unit.source: For the <embeddedLabel>CloudService</embeddedLabel> and <embeddedLabel>AzureWebsite</embeddedLabel> endpoint types, the location cannot be set and is not returned.
trans-unit.target: For the <embeddedLabel>CloudService</embeddedLabel> and <embeddedLabel>AzureWebsite</embeddedLabel> endpoint types, the location cannot be set and is not returned.

trans-unit.source: You can determine the location for these types from the Azure website or Cloud Service.
trans-unit.target: You can determine the location for these types from the Azure website or Cloud Service.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the minimum number of healthy endpoints within a nested profile that determines whether any of the endpoints within that profile can receive traffic.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the minimum number of healthy endpoints within a nested profile that determines whether any of the endpoints within that profile can receive traffic.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the priority of the endpoint in load balancing.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the priority of the endpoint in load balancing.

trans-unit.source: The higher the weight, the more frequently the endpoint will be made available to the load balancer.
trans-unit.target: The higher the weight, the more frequently the endpoint will be made available to the load balancer.

trans-unit.source: For endpoints that do not specify a weight value, a default weight of 1 will be used.
trans-unit.target: For endpoints that do not specify a weight value, a default weight of 1 will be used.
